io.spine.server.delivery

Class ShardedStream<I,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,M,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.delivery.ShardedStream<I,M,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of identifiers of message targets, such as entities
    M - the type of messages, which are being sharded and sent via this stream
    E - the type of envelopes into which the messages are packed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandShardedStream, EventShardedStream, RejectionShardedStream

    public abstract class ShardedStream<I,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,M,?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The stream of messages of a particular type sent for the processing to a specific shard.

    Uses a MessageChannel as an underlying transport.

    A typical example is a stream of Events, being sent from the write-side to a particular shard of read-side Projections.

      An abstract base for builders of the ShardedStream descendants.

      • getKey

        public ShardingKey getKey()
        Obtains the key defining the subset of entities (i.e. a shard), to which the messages of this stream are addressed.
        Returns:
        the key of the shard being a destination for the messages transferred by this stream

      • getTag

        public DeliveryTag<E> getTag()
        Obtains the tag which describes the delivery destination for this stream of messages
        Returns:
        the delivery tag for this stream

      • post

        public final void post(I targetId,
                       E messageEnvelope)
        Posts the message to this stream.

        The message is sent to the corresponding shard via the underlying transport channel.

        Parameters:
        targetId - the ID of target entity, that this message should be dispatched to
        messageEnvelope - the message to post, packed as an envelope
